results.title: The Dresser
results.brief_description: The compelling study of the intense relationship between the exhausted and aging leader of a wartime Shakespearian company, “Sir” (Albert Finney), and his homosexual dresser, Norman (Tom Courtenay). Adapted by Ronald Harwood from his own play, “The Dresser” is based on the touring career of Donald Wolfit whose dresser the author was. A film rich in comedy, compassion and love for the theatre.

results.title: The Dreamlife of angels = La Vie revee des anges
results.creator_credit: Erick Zonca, Francois Marquis, Diaphana Films, France 3 Cinema and Les Productions Bagheera
results.brief_description: Erick Zonca’s feature film debut is a subtle, unflinching, yet compassionate look at the relationship between two young women - Isa (Elodie Bouchez) and Marie (Natacha Regnier), who meet while working as machinists in Lille. The two are diametrically different in appearance, attitude towards life, family and friends, and most significantly in relation towards men and Sandrine; a comatose young girl (Sandrine’s mother owns the flat that Isa and Marie are minding). There are moments of real happiness between the two, and the initial stages of their friendship as it develops is captured beautifully, allowing the viewer to absorb the expressions of each girl and speculate about character development. Their paths soon begin to diverge however - unbalancing their friendship, when Marie becomes involved in a self destructive relationship with night club owner Chris (Gregoire Colin), and Isa starts to visit Sandrine after finding the girl’s diary and becoming privy to her innermost thoughts. As the friends drift further away from one another, they are both faced with situations that challenge them and influence their future both as individuals, and as friends. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Dreaming age = Meng huan shi jie
results.creator_credit: Lin Hongtong and Children's Film Studio (China)
results.brief_description:
Little Luo Fei, a middle-school student, is affected deeply by the changes brought about in her family by the arrival of Hua Guang, a famous musician and her mother’s erstwhile boyfriend.

Credits: Director, Lin Hongtong.
Cast: Wang Chunzi, Lou Jicheng

results.title: The Dreaming
results.creator_credit: Mario Andreacchio, Wayne Groom, Craig Lahiff, Genesis Films, International Film Management and FGH Film Consortium
results.brief_description: Two hundred years ago bands of whalers roamed the oceans. In the Great Southern Land of Australia they discovered natives who cherished a mystical power called the Dreaming - a knowledge handed down from the beginning of their world. The whalers were bloodthirsty men, responsible for rapes killings and massacres - a taint upon the Dreaming. This taint lives on into the present and a new nightmare when a burial ground is unearthed, a girl dies, an ancient curse is revived and a young doctor becomes inextricably involved in a chain of supernatural events that point towards death. Starring Arthur Dignam, Penny Cook, Gary Sweet, Laurence Clifford and Kristina Nehm. Based on a story by Craig Lahiff and Terry Jennings.

results.title: The Dreaming
results.creator_credit: Judy Campbell, Geoffrey Collings, Dahl Collings and Collings Productions
results.brief_description: An exploration of Australian First Nations rock paintings in Arnhem Land that attempts to capture the cultural and spiritual significance and meaning of the art to the local peoples.

results.title: The Dream (Week 2)
results.creator_credit: Colin Bromley, Todd Abbott and Seven Network Limited (Australia)
results.brief_description: A more lighthearted approach to the Games of the 27th Olympiad held in Sydney. Highlights from the television program ‘The Dream with Roy and HG’ (John Doyle and Greig Pickhaver) which ran nightly for the duration of the games. Includes highlights of events and interviews with popular Olympians - both past and present. Features Roy and HG’s special comments on Greco-Roman wrestling, gymnastics, weightlifting, synchronized swimming, diving, taekwondo, boxing and equestrian dressage. Newsbreak with Bardot, Marcia Hines, Billie Jean King, Yvonne Kenny, Sam Riley as well as special guest appearances by Matt Welsh, Hayley Lewis, Gary Hall Jnr, Natalie Cook, Kerrie Pottharst, Todd Woodbridge, Mark Woodford and Tatiana Grigorieva.

results.title: The Dream (Week 1)
results.creator_credit: Colin Bromley, Todd Abbott and Seven Network Limited (Australia)
results.brief_description: A more lighthearted approach to the Olympic Games. Highlights from the television progam ‘The Dream with Roy and HG’ (John Doyle and Greig Pickhaver) which ran nightly for the duration of the Sydney Olympic Games. Includes highlights of events and interviews with popular Olympians - both past and present. This tape shows highlights of week one including Eric Moussambini’s historic solo 100 metre swim, the Russian Gymnastics, diving, rowing and judo finals.

results.title: The Drawings of Leonardo Da Vinci (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Adrian de Potier, Basil Wright and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: Drawings and notes of Leonardo da Vinci from the Royal Collection at Windsor Castle, the Royal Academy and the British Museum with some comment and explanation, to celebrate the quincentenary of Leonardo’s birth. Narrated by Sir Laurence Olivier.

results.title: The Draughtsman's contract
results.creator_credit: Peter Greenaway, David Payne and Channel Four Television
results.brief_description: It is the summer of 1694. An ambitious young draughtsman is contracted to draw the house and estate of the wealthy Mrs Herbert. However, what outwardly appears to be a most proper household is thrown into chaos as his contract includes unrestricted freedom on the estate and Mrs Herbert’s most intimate hospitality. Not even Mrs Herbert’s daughter escapes his charm and magnetism in this intriguing movie of murder, adultery and double values.
